entry.def: in, on, at, by, with, among.
beginning, origin; the person or thing that commences, the first person or thing in a series, the leader; that by which anything begins to be, the origin, the active cause.
to be, to exist, to happen, to be present.

something said (including the thought); by implication, a topic (subject of discourse), also reasoning (the mental faculty) or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, (with the article in John) the Divine Expression (i.e. Christ).
to, towards, with, for; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward.
a deity, especially (with the article) the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
and, also, even, so then, too, etc.
